intro: Cistrum isnardii, commonly known as the narrowleaf cistanthe, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish or reddish in color. It is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with a deep root system that helps it access water from deeper soil layers. Cistrum isnardii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is considered a drought-tolerant species.
